name: Thai-Inspired Red Curry Shrimp
author: babyluv26
summary: Creamy, wonderful Thai-inspired red curry and shrimp dish, tastes just like in restaurants. Serve with jasmine rice or noodles of your choice and top with fresh basil or cilantro. Also wonderful with chicken, and feel free to play around with adding different veggies, yum!
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste
1 teaspoon Thai red curry paste, or more to taste
1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: Heat oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat until almost smoking
Add garlic and ginger and saute for 30 seconds
Add onion and heat until softened, about 2 minutes
Add carrots and red pepper and saute until softened, about 7 minutes
Pour in coconut milk, soy sauce, and curry paste; stir until curry paste and coconut milk are well blended
Lower the heat and simmer until the shrimp are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, 3 to 4 minutes
